Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style or Grand Style, pottery large chalice or heavy chalice with part of bowl; white slip; glaze fired red-brown; interior: glazed with reserved dot in centre of bowl; exterior: reserved on bowl; foot glazed (worn) on outside, underside reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The incline and the thickness of the foot suggest that the foot may have been tall. Early chalices had a short squat foot, while Mature Animal Style and Grand Style chalices and chalice kraters had a comparatively higher foot.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1348) (phase 2)
